transportAdvice: Salzburg's compact old town is highly walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot; the city also has a reliable bus network that connects tourist areas, the train station, and outer districts. Taxis are widely available, and the central location makes it easy to explore without a car.

weather.description: Cold winter month with frequent snowfall and overcast skies, ideal for festive atmosphere but pack warm layers.
Still cold and wintry with occasional snow, though daylight hours begin to lengthen slightly.
Early spring brings milder temperatures but changeable weather with rain and lingering cold snaps.
Spring arrives with greener landscapes and pleasant mild days, though showers are common.
Warm and lush with frequent afternoon rain showers; one of the wetter months but very scenic.
Early summer is warm and green with regular thunderstorms, especially in the afternoons.
Peak summer with warm sunny days and occasional heavy thunderstorms; the busiest tourist month.
Similar to July with warm temperatures and afternoon storms; the famous Salzburg Festival draws large crowds.
Early autumn brings cooler, more settled weather with beautiful golden foliage beginning to appear.
Noticeably cooler with misty mornings and colourful autumn scenery; a quieter and charming time to visit.
Grey and damp with fog common in the valleys; temperatures drop steadily toward winter.
Cold and festive with famous Christmas markets, possible snow, and a magical winter atmosphere.
